    Collaborations

    Cyberinfrastructure for the Large Hadron Collider

    We lead the ATLAS Midwest Tier2 Center, providing 30 000 CPU-cores, 10 PB of storage, integrated into the worldwide LHC computing grid, accessible by every member of the international collaboration.

    Read more →

    Computing for the South Pole Telescope

    MANIAC Lab operates cyberinfrastructure at the South Pole and SPT analysis facilities in Chicago

    Read more →

    High Throughput Computing for VERITAS

    MANIAC Lab provides storage and workflow cyberinfrastructure for VERITAS, the Very Energetic Radiation Imaging Telescope Array System

    Read more →

    A Global Data Network for XENON

    MANIAC Lab operates the Rucio global data management service for the XENON Dark Matter Search Experiment in Gran Sasso, Italy.

    Read more →
